intro: Pimelea flava, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant is well adapted to drought conditions. Pimelea flava plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
